item.title: How to sinmulate proof of work in SQL and BigQuery
item.description: (or: How does blockchain mining work?) A miner has to solve a mathematical problem to validate a block for the Blockhain. The so called Proof of Work requires a lot of computing power aka energy and therefore is quite expensive. Googles BigQuery has a price model, that charges you for the transferred data and not the computing power. Meaning: You can utilize a lot of computing power for free. If you are able to reproduce the mining algorithm in SQL.

item.title: 2025-08-01 Monitor SSL Traffic On Android
item.description:
Fantastic Preface

Monitoring SSL Traffic of Android Apps is quite a challenge these days. While it’s an important way to understand how Apps work, find security flaws or possible data breaches, a weak encrypted traffic also is a potential security risk.

These days, most apps use a thing called “certificate pinning”, which makes it quite difficult to monitor traffic. You need a rooted device, to bypass certificate pinning. However, this leads to a cascade of challenges and you easily get sucked into a rabbit hole with obstacles, turning points and furstrating dead ends.
